newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt pound rates rise despite liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Egypt pound rates rise despite liquidity.

text.p: Overnight and one-week interbank rates on the Egyptian pound rose despite an unusually liquid private-sector market on Sunday, bankers said. The market is typically short on Sundays, the start of the trading week.
Overnight rates went up to between 9-3/8 and 9-3/4 percent from 8-1/2 to nine percent on Thursday, bankers said. Most did four-night deals rather than overnight.
One-week rates rose to between 9-1/2 and 10-1/8 percent from between 8/1-2 and 9-1/4 percent on Thursday, they added.
Bankers cited the central bank's acceptance of few bids in its 91-day treasury bill auction on Wednesday as one factor behind the unusually high liquidity.
The bank had asked for 700 million pounds and accepted bids for 761.75 million, rejecting bids for 881.75 million.
"The stock market weakness is another factor," a banker said.
Public-sector banks kept their rates steady at 10-1/2 percent on Sunday.
